definition[0]: to move away from the place you should be
example[0]: Three of the soldiers strayed into enemy territory.
definition[1]: to begin to deal with or think about a different subject from the main one, without intending to
example[1]: This meeting is beginning to stray from the point.
example[2]: Weâ€™re straying into ethnic issues here.
definition[2]: if your eyes stray, you begin to look at something else, usually without intending to
example[3]: Her eyes strayed to the clock.
definition[3]: to start doing something that is wrong or immoral, when usually you do not do this
definition[4]: a stray animal, such as a dog or cat, is lost or has no home
definition[5]: accidentally separated from other things of the same kind
example[4]: One man was hit by a stray bullet and taken to hospital.
definition[6]: an animal that is lost or has no home
definition[7]: someone or something that has become separated from others of the same kind
